== Literature that this thesis is based on

Various research papers, book chapters and magazine articles have already been published about the material discussed in this thesis. This section contains a brief 'glossary' of this published work and provides some pointers to their relation to the thesis.

**A Fully Generic Approach for Realizing the Adaptive Web**\\
De Bra, P., Smits, D. (2012)
Sofsem 2012 conference, Czech Republic, January 22-26, 2012. (pp. 64-76) Springer LNCS.
Describing the GALE [[gale/system|architecture]], the [[gale/gam|GAM]] language and some of GALE's advanced [[gale/system/caching|caching features]].
**GRAPPLE: Learning Management Systems meet Adaptive Learning Environments**\\
De Bra, P., Smits, D., van der Sluijs, K., Cristea, A.I., Foss, J., Glahn, C., Steiner, C. (2012 to appear)
Chapter 6, In: Intelligent and Adaptive Educational-Learning Systems: Achievements and Trends, Smart Innovation, Systems and Technologies, KES-Springer Verlang Book Series, 2012
A complete overview of what has been achieved in the [[research/grapple|GRAPPLE project]].
**Bridging navigation, search and adaptation: adaptive hypermedia models evolution**\\
Knutov, E., Bra, P. de, Smits, D., Pechenizkiy, M. (2011)
Proceedings of the 7th International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies (WEBIST 2011, Noordwijkerhout, The Netherlands, May 6-9, 2011)
Providing one of the ideas mentioned as [[future-work|future work]].
**GALE: a highly extensible adaptive hypermedia engine**\\
Smits, D., De Bra, P. (2011)
Proceedings of the 22nd ACM Conference on Hypertext and Hypermedia (Eindhoven, The Netherlands, June 6-9, 2011)
The [[gale/system|GALE architecture]] and [[gale/modifying-resource|authoring]].
**GRAPPLE: Personalization and adaptation in learning management systems**\\
De Bra, P., Smits, D., Sluijs, K.A.M. van der, Cristea, A.I., Hendrix, M. (2010)
Proceedings of World Conference on Educational Multimedia, Hypermedia and Telecommunications 2010
Authoring for GALE using the [[research/gat|GRAPPLE Authoring Tools (GAT)]].
**Making today's Learning Management Systems adaptive**\\
Oneto, L., Abel, F., Herder, E., Smits, S. (2009)
Learning Management Systems meet Adaptive Learning Environments, Workshop at European Conference on Technology Enhanced Learning (ECTEL)
Integrating GALE in LMSs in the [[research/grapple|GRAPPLE]] project using [[research/gumf|GUMF]].
**Unifying adaptive learning environments : authoring styles in the GRAPPLE project**\\
De Bra, P., Smits, D., Knutov, E., Ploum, E., Sluijs, K.A.M. van der (2009)
Adjunct Proceedings First International Conference on User Modeling, Adaptation, and Personalization (UMAP 2009, Trento, Italy, June 22-26, 2009)
Different methods of authoring adaptive content.
**LAG 2.0: Refining a reusable adaptation language and improving on its authoring**\\
Cristea, A.I., Smits, D., Bevan, J.D., Hendrix, M. (2009)
Learning in the synergy of multiple disciplines: 4th european conference on technology enhanced learning (EC-TEL 2009 Nice, France, September 29-October 2, 2009)
Strategy based approach to adaptation arguing that simple adaptation rules like those found in AHA! may not be enough.
**GRAPPLE: Integrating adaptive learning into learning management systems**\\
De Bra, P., Pechenizkiy, M., Sluijs, K.A.M. van der, Smits, D. (2008)
Proceedings of World Conference on Educational Multimedia, Hypermedia and Telecommunications 2008
Early ideas on GRAPPLE, taking functions in the [[aha/graph-author|]] and using them in [[research/gat|GAT]].
**Adaptivity in GRAPPLE: Adaptation in any way you like (Poster)**\\
De Bra, P., Smits, D., Pechenizkiy, M., Vasilyeva, E. (2008) Proceedings of the World Conference on E-Learning in Corporate, Government, Healthcare and Higher Education (E-Learn 2008, Las Vegas NV, USA, November 17-21, 2008)
Showing the intermediate version of AHA! (version 4) that resulted from [[research/als|ALS]] and was further developed within [[research/grapple|GRAPPLE]].
**Defining adaptation in a generic multi layer model: CAM: The GRAPPLE Conceptual Adaptation Model**\\
Hendrix, M., De Bra, P., Pechenizkiy, M., Smits, D., Cristea, A.I. (2008) Third European Conference on Technology Enhanced Learning (EC-TEL 2008, Maastricht, September 18-19, 2008, Proceedings)
Early ideas on the [[research/cam|Conceptual Adaptation Model]].
**Authoring and management tools for adaptive educational hypermedia systems: the AHA! case study**\\
De Bra, P., Stash, N., Smits, D., Romero, C., Ventura, S. (2007) Evolution of Teaching and Learning Paradigms in Intelligent Environment (pp. 285-308) Berlin: Springer
Detailing the various tools available to [[aha/authoring|author]] applications in AHA!, including the [[aha/concept-editor|]] and [[aha/graph-author|]].
**Towards a generic adaptive hypermedia platform: a conversion case study**\\
Cristea, A.I., Smits, D., De Bra, P. (2007) Journal of Digital Information, 8(3)
Converting from MOT and LAG to AHA!; how high level adaptation strategies can be compiled to low level adaptation rules.
**Specification, authoring and prototyping of personalised workplace learning solutions**\\
Dolog, P., Kravcik, M., Cristea, A.I., Burgos, D., De Bra, P., Ceri, S., Devedzic, V., Houben, G.J.P.M., Libbrecht, P., Matera, M., Melis, E., Nejdl, W., Specht, M., Stewart, C., Smits, D., Stash, N., Tattersall, C. (2007) International Journal of Learning Technology, 3(3) (pp. 286-308)
Reviewing models and languages available to describe a problem domain and adaptation.

De Bra, P., Smits, D., Stash, N. (2006) Proceedings of the 17th ACM Conference on Hypertext and Hypermedia (HT'06, Odense, Denmark, August 22-25, 2006)

**Creating and delivering adaptive courses with AHA!**\\

Explaining the [[aha/models|domain model]] used in [[aha|AHA!]].
**Writing MOT, reading AHA!: converting between an authoring and a delivery system for adaptive educational hypermedia**\\
